page.title: 10DEPENDENCE ON ROAD TRANSPORT
page.content: {The population}of this rural area is completely dependent on road transport. Fortunately the area is well served by roads, the A699 from St Boswells to Selkirk crossing from north-east to west and branching south are the B6359 from Melrose & the B6453 leading through Midlem to Lilliesleaf. {Roads}are kept in excellent condition by the Border Region, and they are rapidly cleared and gritted during snowy weather. During recent flooding, the Council were immediately on the scene to do the necessary repairs. {Many}of the region's residents are car owners, but for the old-aged pensioners of Midlem for example, the daily post-bus is their only means of travelling to Galashiels. Similarly, Peel General Hospital can only be reached twice weekly by the Border Courier Bus.
